
### T-I-O exercise: L1  {.smaller}

<table>
<tr><td>quantity</td><td>value for L1</td></tr>
<tr><td>block size (given)</td><td>$B=64\text{Byte}$</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="2">$B=2^b$ ($b$: block offset bits)</td></tr>
<tr><td>block offset bits</td><td>$b=$<em>$6$</em></td></tr>
<tr><td>blocks/set (given)</td><td>$E=8$</td></tr>
<tr><td>cache size (given)</td><td>$C = 32\text{KB} = E \times{} B \times{} S$</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="2">$S = \frac{C}{B\times E}$ ($S$: number of sets)</td></tr>
<tr><td>number of sets</td><td>$S = \frac{32\text{KB}}{64\text{Byte}\times 8} =$ <em>$64$</em></td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="2">$S = 2^s$ ($s$: set index bits)</td></tr>
<tr><td>set index bits</td><td>$s = \text{log}_2(64)=$ <em>$6$</em></td></tr>
</table>
